title: Description of the GRID db
text: tables database following table names, column names row column counts: tables database based CSV format. format described detail : https://grid.ac/format.
code: library(institutions) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(purrr) library(knitr)  institutions_download()  # fcn to describe a table  desc_table <- function(x)   tibble(     tablename = x,     rowcount = institutions_table(x) %>% nrow(),     colcount = institutions_table(x) %>% ncol(),     colnames = institutions_table(x) %>% names() %>% paste0(collapse = ", ")   )  # iterate over existing tables and display results  tables <- institutions_tables()  desc <-  tables %>% map_df(desc_table) %>%  arrange(desc(rowcount))  knitr::kable(desc)

title: Description of the GRID db
text: size disk generated files (SQLite db larger zipped CSVs downloaded due Full Text Search tables generated added database): File grid.zip size 37.3 Mb File grid.db size 58.7 Mb
code: cfg <- institutions_cfg()  print_fs <- function(x)    sprintf("File %s has size %s", basename(x),            utils:::format.object_size(file.info(x)$size, "auto"))  files <- c(cfg$zip, cfg$db)  sizes <- map_chr(files, print_fs)

title: Data from the Research Organization Registry Community
text: full dataset available can summarized.

title: Data from the Research Organization Registry Community
text: examples:
code: # what top five types of orgs are represented in this data? ror$ror_types %>% count(types) %>% arrange(desc(n)) %>% head(5) #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   types          n #>   <chr>      <int> #> 1 Company    30784 #> 2 Education  22186 #> 3 Funder     17122 #> 4 Nonprofit  15068 #> 5 Healthcare 13933  # top 5 companies with many aliases ror$ror_aliases %>% count(aliases) %>% arrange(desc(n)) %>% head(5) #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   aliases                                         n #>   <chr>                                       <int> #> 1 Merck Sharp & Dohme                            15 #> 2 Hoffmann-La Roche                              13 #> 3 ASEA Brown Boveri                              11 #> 4 E. I. du Pont de Nemours and Company           11 #> 5 International Business Machines Corporation    11  # why does IBM have so many acronyms? seemingly because it is a multi-national corp. ror$ror_aliases %>% filter(aliases == "International Business Machines Corporation") %>%    inner_join(ror$ror_orgs) %>%  pull(name) %>% paste0(collapse = ", ") #> Joining with `by = join_by(id)` #> [1] "IBM (France), IBM (Belgium), IBM (India), IBM (Egypt), IBM (Denmark), IBM (Portugal), IBM (Czechia), IBM (Ireland), IBM (Brazil), IBM (Slovakia), IBM (Germany)"  # what is the most frequently used acronym and which orgs use this abbreviation for its name? ror$ror_acronyms %>% count(acronyms) %>% arrange(desc(n)) #> # A tibble: 33,870 × 2 #>    acronyms     n #>    <chr>    <int> #>  1 CCC         44 #>  2 MU          33 #>  3 AU          32 #>  4 SCC         31 #>  5 HCC         30 #>  6 MCC         30 #>  7 CRC         29 #>  8 CMC         27 #>  9 MSU         27 #> 10 ARC         26 #> # ℹ 33,860 more rows ror$ror_acronyms %>% filter(acronyms == "CCC") %>% inner_join(ror$ror_orgs) %>% pull(name) %>% paste0(collapse = ", ") #> Joining with `by = join_by(id)` #> [1] "Clatterbridge Cancer Centre NHS Foundation Trust, Committee on Climate Change, Camden County College, Capital Consulting Corporation (United States), IEA Clean Coal Centre, Colby Community College, Crile Carvey Consulting, Children's Cancer Center, Community Cancer Center, Capital Community College, Clatsop Community College, Central City Concern, Cleveland Community College, California Coastal Commission, California Conservation Corps, Chinese Culture Center of San Francisco, Clearwater Christian College, Clovis Community College, Coahoma Community College, Cumberland County College, Carolina Christian College, Consolidated Contractors Company (Greece), Community Care College, California Christian College, Craven Community College, Coffeyville Community College, Carteret Community College, Center for Community Change, Carbohydrate Competence Center, Cancer Research UK Cambridge Center, Sport Wales, Crichton Carbon Centre, Canola Council of Canada, Bowel Cancer UK, Cameron (United States), Cameron (United Kingdom), Childhood Cancer Canada Foundation, Comprehensive Cancer Center Vienna, City College of Calamba, Clinton Community College, SUNY Corning Community College, Clackamas Community College, Centro de Química de Coimbra, IUCN Climate Crisis Commission"  # some orgs have more than one link, seems to be duplicates? ror$ror_links %>% group_by(id) %>% count(links) %>% filter(n > 1) %>% ungroup() #> # A tibble: 0 × 3 #> # ℹ 3 variables: id <chr>, links <chr>, n <int> ror$ror_links %>% filter(id == "https://ror.org/01eea1w69")  #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   id                        links                           #>   <chr>                     <chr>                           #> 1 https://ror.org/01eea1w69 https://www.southernwater.co.uk

title: Data from the Research Organization Registry Community
code: extids <- ror$ror_ids # which external identifiers are most frequently provided? # one given identifier can have multiple other identifiers esp FundRef extids %>% group_by(name) %>% count() %>% arrange(desc(n)) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #> # Groups: name [4] #> name n #> #> 1 GRID 113119 #> 2 ISNI 55891 #> 3 Wikidata 53254 #> 4 FundRef 20466 # which WikiData identifiers does a set of orgs have? ids_wikidata <- extids %>% filter( id %in% c("https://ror.org/052gg0110", "https://ror.org/013meh722"), name == "Wikidata") %>% distinct() %>% pull("value") knitr::kable(escape = FALSE, tibble(url = sprintf("%s", ids_wikidata, ids_wikidata)))

title: Global Research Identifier Database (GRID)
text: goal R package institutions provide access institutional data R Global Research Identifier Database (GRID) available Creative Commons Public Domain 1.0 International licence (see https://grid.ac). dataset used example Altmetric, Dimensions, Figshare others. package also embeds data Research Organization Registry Community (see https://ror.org/). ROR IDs metadata provided Creative Commons CC0 1.0 Universal Public Domain Dedication. restrictions access use ROR IDs metadata. information dataset can found : https://ror.org/facts/#core-components. ror dataset provides acccess data within R; ror$ror_ids table contains external identifers including, records, GRID identifier. identifier can used link ROR data GRID dataset exposed R package.

title: Global Research Identifier Database (GRID)
text: R package kind “data package” primarily intended used provide reference data (GRID ROR) used workflows. “data package”, since provides functions might also useful data wrangling reference data (mainly supporting geocoding full text search lookups). package downloads curated data https://digitalscience.figshare.com/ndownloader/files/20151785 migrates full text search indexed SQLite database residing locally. FTS-enabled database exposed couple functions way tibbles. idea show provide access potentially provide access larger database enable use -built full text search capabilities SQLite downloading potentially big remote data installing locally using rappdirs. approach, R package can stay small. minor practical drawbacks - mostly package initially work -line least one initial successfull call download data made require connection Internet. upside able tap things like Full Text Search datasets approach package can stay small pass CRAN checks without requiring exceptions, dataset size limited 2TB (SQLite limitation).

title: Global Research Identifier Database (GRID)
text: can install development version institutions GitHub :

title: Global Research Identifier Database (GRID)
text: basic example shows get started: full text search institutional addresses locations (see details FTS syntax ): tables database can enumerated accessed individually: Custom queries can made:
code: library(institutions)  # on first run, make sure to download the data which will generate the SQLite db  institutions_download()  # where are the data files - remotely and locally? institutions_cfg() #> $src_url #> [1] "https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/30895309" #>  #> $dest #> [1] "~/.config/institutions" #>  #> $zip #> [1] "~/.config/institutions/grid.zip" #>  #> $db #> [1] "~/.config/institutions/grid.db" # do a full text search for institutions matching the search query "Royal AND Technology institutions_search("Royal AND Technology") #> # A tibble: 1 × 15 #>   institutes     grid_id line_1 line_2 line_3   lat   lng postcode primary city  #>   <chr>          <chr>   <chr>  <chr>   <int> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <int> <chr> #> 1 Royal Institu… grid.5… <NA>   <NA>       NA  59.3  18.1 <NA>           0 Stoc… #> # ℹ 5 more variables: state <chr>, state_code <chr>, country <chr>, #> #   country_code <chr>, geonames_city_id <dbl> # enumerate all db tables institutions_tables() #>  [1] "acronyms"      "addresses"     "aliases"       "external_ids"  #>  [5] "geonames"      "grid"          "institutes"    "labels"        #>  [9] "links"         "relationships" "types"  # get acronym data institutions_table("acronyms") #> # A tibble: 42,840 × 2 #>    grid_id     acronym #>    <chr>       <chr>   #>  1 grid.1001.0 ANU     #>  2 grid.1003.2 UQ      #>  3 grid.1005.4 UNSW    #>  4 grid.1007.6 UOW     #>  5 grid.1009.8 UTAS    #>  6 grid.1011.1 JCU     #>  7 grid.1012.2 UWA     #>  8 grid.1013.3 USYD    #>  9 grid.1016.6 CSIRO   #> 10 grid.1017.7 RMIT    #> # ℹ 42,830 more rows # a custom query, first get an id to work with id <- institutions_search("Royal Institute of Technology")$grid_id  # assemble some sql using that id sql <- sprintf("select * from links where grid_id = '%s'", id)  institutions_query(sql) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   grid_id     link                 #>   <chr>       <chr>                #> 1 grid.5037.1 http://www.kth.se/en

what: Lookup coordinates using the MapQuest API — geocode_mapquest
title: Lookup coordinates using the MapQuest API — geocode_mapquest
text: function requires environment variable set MAPQUEST_API_KEY

title: Lookup coordinates using the MapQuest API — geocode_mapquest
Lookup coordinates using the MapQuest API — geocode_mapquest
text: street character string street zip character string zip code city character string city country character string county, 2 letter abbreviation, default "SE" location provided hold full location string, params disregarded

title: Lookup coordinates using the MapQuest API — geocode_mapquest
text: tibble results

title: Lookup coordinates using the MapQuest API — geocode_mapquest
text: Sign free API-key https://developer.mapquest.com/plan_purchase/steps/business_edition/business_edition_free/register Add MAPQUEST_API_KEY .Renviron using file.edit('~/.Renviron') add line MAPQUEST_API_KEY=<yourkey> run readRenviron('~/.Renviron') load environment variable session. entitles use 15 000 free transactions per month. Either use street, zip, city country parameters (), use location parameter.

text: dataset licensed Creative Commons Public Domain 1.0 International licence. used example Altmetric, Dimensions, Figshare others. local SQLite db created based distribution institutional data https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/30895309 created extending remotely distributed dataset support Full Text Search extended database exposed package couple functions way tibbles. idea show provide access potentially larger database enable use -built full text search capabilities SQLite downloading potentially big remote data installing locally using https://rdrr.io/cran/rappdirs/ can relevant considering release package CRAN provides access datasets R also want follow general recommendation CRAN checks "package data smaller megabyte" thus avoiding argue separately CRAN maintainers making exception rule (see details : http://r-pkgs..co.nz/data.html#data-cran). approach, package can stay small. minor practical drawbacks - mostly package initially work -line least one initial successfull call download data made using institutions_download require connection Internet. upside able tap things like Full Text Search datasets approach package can stay small pass CRAN checks without requiring exceptions, dataset size limited 2TB (SQLite limitation).

title: Full text search for names of institutions — institutions_search
code: institutions_search("^Stockholm AND University") #> Warning: No database available at /home/runner/.config/institutions/grid.db please use institutions_download() first #> Downloading data from https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/30895309 #> Generating db, storing at /home/runner/.config/institutions/grid.db #> Generating Full Text Search index #> # A tibble: 3 × 15 #>   institutes     grid_id line_1 line_2 line_3   lat   lng postcode primary city  #>   <chr>          <chr>   <chr>  <chr>   <int> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <int> <chr> #> 1 Stockholm Uni… grid.1… NA     NA         NA  59.4  18.1 NA             0 Stoc… #> 2 Stockholm Uni… grid.4… NA     NA         NA  59.3  18.1 NA             0 Stoc… #> 3 Stockholm Uni… grid.5… NA     NA         NA  59.2  17.9 NA             0 Hudd… #> # ℹ 5 more variables: state <chr>, state_code <chr>, country <chr>, #> #   country_code <chr>, geonames_city_id <dbl>  institutions_search(tolower("Royal Institute of Technology")) #> # A tibble: 1 × 15 #>   institutes     grid_id line_1 line_2 line_3   lat   lng postcode primary city  #>   <chr>          <chr>   <chr>  <chr>   <int> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <int> <chr> #> 1 Royal Institu… grid.5… NA     NA         NA  59.3  18.1 NA             0 Stoc… #> # ℹ 5 more variables: state <chr>, state_code <chr>, country <chr>, #> #   country_code <chr>, geonames_city_id <dbl>
